column4: I'm trying to convert m4a music files into waves or mp3s. Is that possable with XMMS?
poprocks: can you tell me how to go about it in mplayer?
use mplayer
but it's way better to just rerip to ogg or mp3
i downloaded them as m4a...so if i convert them to mp3's will their be a loss of quality in sound?
yes, don't know if it will be noticable or not
cdrecord dev=/dev/cdrom blah.iso, for instance
that's just a warning
if you run it as 'sudo cdrecord...' it will go away (and might be a good idea if you have a slowish machine)
the warning about unofficialness is due to the cdrecord author being a somewhat interesting person with a strong disliked of linux
with what?
why do you think that?
I don't know what your question is, you haven't explained what isn't working
er, of course...data and audio cds are different cd formats
I still don't get what you think the problem
are you asking 'How do I burn an audio cd?'?
ok.  'sudo cdparanoia dev=/dev/cdrom -audio *.wav' should be enough.
do I need to make any adjustments to what you typed? such as the cd drive?
you need to include the line where you typed the command, too
thanks for the help but i'm giving up. ..least for tonight. I'm not going to figure this our by myself and I'm not going to figure it out here.
ok
